*[toxcore/network.c, line 407 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/662#-L2Wot1DM7yWD60CMxox:-L2Wot1Eyw9aTAgoKirr:bbzqs2q) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/3e49feceb9e197ae8d84b936e5d0135eac7bb2ab/toxcore/network.c#L407)):*

> Family net_family(const Networking_Core *net) {

Wrong indentation. Should be 4 spaces.

*[toxcore/network.c, line 411 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/662#-L2WozF5YyE-60XpB678:-L2WozF5YyE-60XpB679:bbzqs2q) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/3e49feceb9e197ae8d84b936e5d0135eac7bb2ab/toxcore/network.c#L411)):*

Wrong indentation. Should be 4 spaces.

---

*[toxcore/network.c, line 843 at r6](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/662#-L2Wozr9Bsgb13egZFI-:-L2Wozr9Bsgb13egZFI0:bbzqs2q) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/3e49feceb9e197ae8d84b936e5d0135eac7bb2ab/toxcore/network.c#L843)):*

Wrong indentation. Should be 4 spaces.

commit.message:
Call freeaddrinfo on error paths in net_getipport.

Without these, we'll have a memory leak on error paths.

verification.payload:
tree 4bd8042fbb6dc1eaa2f6f7b2b6825ad62e05dc69
parent 6c523f9f48e64362bb7d191ba54c7c56be5b10c0
author iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515591194 +0000
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515610637 +0000

Call freeaddrinfo on error paths in net_getipport.

Without these, we'll have a memory leak on error paths.

commit.message:
Zero-initialise stack-allocated objects in hstox driver.

These potentially cause uninitialised reads on some platforms or msgpack
library versions.

verification.payload:
tree 70306fa1aed59c59eeef194cc1a64139a6b9df6b
parent 79d8a22b4811083daf0a65fc94939b47c47997b7
author iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515590865 +0000
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515610645 +0000

Zero-initialise stack-allocated objects in hstox driver.

These potentially cause uninitialised reads on some platforms or msgpack
library versions.

commit.message:
Fix file descriptor leak in hstox test.

We return E_WRITE because closing only fails when an I/O error occurs,
which is likely an error from the write() call above. See close(2) for
details.

http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/close.2.html

verification.payload:
tree 73c072bfda6f0f2a48846ee9c8b66fd3e621c94b
parent 2e33ab26df4356c40a4c9b636f99a7bfbdc7838c
author iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515590527 +0000
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515610649 +0000

Fix file descriptor leak in hstox test.

We return E_WRITE because closing only fails when an I/O error occurs,
which is likely an error from the write() call above. See close(2) for
details.

http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/close.2.html

Also replace &(x) with &x for consistency.

commit.message:
Increase test retries to 10 (basically infinite).

This basically means: try until you run out of time (50 minutes on
Travis). On Linux, we really want the tests to pass, so there is no point
in limiting the number of retries. On windows, we don't retry, on FreeBSD
it's limited to 1.

verification.payload:
tree 07a7598d9de1b30f40053ddb192568b7670b5432
parent 54ec162558f203242639b382eea6e0085300249c
author iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515594884 +0000
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1515610662 +0000

Increase test retries to 10 (basically infinite).

This basically means: try until you run out of time (50 minutes on
Travis). On Linux, we really want the tests to pass, so there is no point
in limiting the number of retries. On windows, we don't retry, on FreeBSD
it's limited to 1.

commit.message:
Move Networking_Core struct into the .c file.

To make it an abstract type everywhere except in network.c.
